title: AnatomicalSystem
name: AnatomicalSystem
description: An anatomical system is a group of anatomical structures that work together to perform a certain task. Anatomical systems, such as organ systems, are one organizing principle of anatomy, and can includes circulatory, digestive, endocrine, integumentary, immune, lymphatic, muscular, nervous, reproductive, respiratory, skeletal, urinary, vestibular, and other systems.

associatedPathophysiology.title: associatedPathophysiology
associatedPathophysiology.description: If applicable, a description of the pathophysiology associated with the anatomical system, including potential abnormal changes in the mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions of the system.

comprisedOf.title: comprisedOf
comprisedOf.description: The underlying anatomical structures, such as organs, that comprise the anatomical system.

relatedCondition.title: relatedCondition
relatedCondition.description: A medical condition associated with this anatomy.

relatedStructure.title: relatedStructure
relatedStructure.description: Related anatomical structure(s) that are not part of the system but relate or connect to it, such as vascular bundles associated with an organ system.

relatedTherapy.title: relatedTherapy
relatedTherapy.description: A medical therapy related to this anatomy.

code.title: code
code.description: A medical code for the entity, taken from a controlled vocabulary or ontology such as ICD-9, DiseasesDB, MeSH, SNOMED-CT, RxNorm, etc.

guideline.title: guideline
guideline.description: A medical guideline related to this entity.

medicineSystem.title: medicineSystem
medicineSystem.description: The system of medicine that includes this MedicalEntity, for example 'evidence-based', 'homeopathic', 'chiropractic', etc.

recognizingAuthority.title: recognizingAuthority
recognizingAuthority.description: If applicable, the organization that officially recognizes this entity as part of its endorsed system of medicine.

relevantSpecialty.title: relevantSpecialty
relevantSpecialty.description: If applicable, a medical specialty in which this entity is relevant.

study.title: study
study.description: A medical study or trial related to this entity.

additionalType.title: additionalType
additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

description.title: description
description.description: A short description of the item.

image.title: image
image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

potentialAction.title: potentialAction
potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

sameAs.title: sameAs
sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
